messages.message:
Thanks @Heymian- it seems to be an internet glitch, I’m hitting it from time to time but it usually goes away. And as I rebuild many times, I start to hit another error

```[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-assembly-plugin:2.6:single (make-assembly) on project table-tservice: Failed to create assembly: Error creating assembly archive jar-with-dependencies: Problem creating jar: Execution exception: No space left on device -> [Help 1]```
Any idea how to solve this?
And overall, do you recommend people building things locally on their laptop, or should I just try using our build machine? My internet seems to be fine, but I had hit that internet glitch many times
you should probably use the build machine. You’ll likely run out of docker hard drive space (Do you see a docker error code? error 137 or something like that)
if you click on the docker icon > preferences > disk space. you should see how much space you’ve used up

if you see that it’s full, you can do two things - 1. increase the size of your docker partition to like 80 or 100gb (default is 60 i think?) And 2. prune your unused docker containers: docker system prune -all
:thumbsup: thanks! yeah default is 64gb, I’ll increase it, follow your instructions and try again.
